contentrichtext.text: [[File:Map.Shimodate-CIty.Ibaraki.PNG|thumb|Map of Shimodate, Ibaraki]] {{nihongo|'''Shimodate'''|下館市|Shimodate-shi}} was a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Ibaraki Prefecture|Ibaraki]], [[Japan]]. On March 28, 2005 Shimodate was merged with the towns of [[Akeno, Ibaraki|Akeno]], [[Kyōwa, Ibaraki|Kyōwa]] and [[Sekijō, Ibaraki|Sekijō]], all from [[Makabe District, Ibaraki|Makabe District]], to form the new city of [[Chikusei, Ibaraki|Chikusei]]. As of this merger, Shimodate no longer exists. As of 2003, the city had an estimated [[population]] of 64,467 and the [[population density|density]] of 747.44 persons per km². The total area was 86.25 km². The city was founded on March 15, 1954, centered around [[Shimodate Station]] on the JR [[Mito Line]]. It is also the southern terminus of the [[Mooka Railway Mooka Line|Mooka Line]] (ex-JR, transferred to private ownership 1988) and the northern terminus of the [[Kanto Railway]] [[Jōsō Line]]. ==External links== * [http://www.city.chikusei.lg.jp/ Official website of Chikusei] {{ja icon}} {{Ibaraki}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ibaraki Prefecture]] {{Ibaraki-geo-stub}}
